  proposition: Rishabh Bhardwaj, Duc Anh Do, and Soujanya Poria published "Language Models are Homer Simpson!" at the 62nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Rishabh Bhardwaj|AUTHOR|"Language Models are Homer Simpson!"
    Duc Anh Do|AUTHOR|"Language Models are Homer Simpson!"
    Soujanya Poria|AUTHOR|"Language Models are Homer Simpson!"
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Rishabh Bhardwaj|CO_AUTHOR|Duc Anh Do
    Rishabh Bhardwaj|CO_AUTHOR|Soujanya Poria
    Duc Anh Do|CO_AUTHOR|Soujanya Poria
    Rishabh Bhardwaj|PUBLISHED_IN|Association for Computational Linguistics
    Duc Anh Do|PUBLISHED_IN|Association for Computational Linguistics
    Soujanya Poria|PUBLISHED_IN|Association for Computational Linguistics

  proposition: The publication focuses on safety re-alignment of fine-tuned language models through task arithmetic.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    "Language Models are Homer Simpson!"|FOCUS|safety re-alignment of fine-tuned language models
    "Language Models are Homer Simpson!"|METHOD|task arithmetic

  proposition: The conference was held in Bangkok, Thailand in August 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Association for Computational Linguistics|LOCATION|Bangkok
    Association for Computational Linguistics|COUNTRY|Thailand
    Association for Computational Linguistics|DATE|August 2024

  proposition: Upol Ehsan, Q. Vera Liao, Samir Passi, Mark O. Riedl, and Hal Daumé published "Seamful XAI: Operationalizing Seamful Design in Explainable AI" in Proceedings of the ACM Human-Computer Interaction.

  proposition: Omar Shaikh, Michelle Lam, Joey Hejna, Yijia Shao, Michael Bernstein, and Diyi Yang authored "Show, Don't Tell: Aligning Language Models with Demonstrated Feedback" in 2024.
